page.title: 13Shopping in Eccles 2
page.content: Further along Church St. a cinema has closed and it has been converted into a 'Kwik Save' supermarket. Along the main road towards the library there is a variety of small shops, such as a pork butchers, stationers, a DIY shop, banks, solicitors and various public houses, one of which is called The Town Hall. The Town Hall proper is also on this street and so is the Post Office. Shopping in Eccles has been developed considerably since the precinct was built as there were streets of terraced houses on the site previously. There are a number of small cafes and 'take-aways' on the street, including chip shops. Nearly all of the pubs serve lunch time bar snacks as well.
